thread.title: Oxford 'gas' explosion: Block of flats 'reduced to rubble' in huge blast as emergency services rush to scene
thread.title_full: Oxford 'gas' explosion: Block of flats 'reduced to rubble' in huge blast as emergency services rush to scene

author: Patrick Lion
title: Oxford 'gas' explosion: Block of flats 'reduced to rubble' in huge blast as emergency services rush to scene

organizations.name: oxfordshire county council fire and rescue

text:
Flames rip through the building after the huge explosion in Oxford (Photo: @LukeSproule / Twitter) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A massive explosion has completely destroyed a block of flats, it has been reported. 
Local residents have speculated the cause of the blast at the three-storey block in Oxford may be gas related. 
Footage and photos from the scene have shown a massive fireball over the building as flames ripped through boats parked nearby. 
Police, ambulance and fire crews and a helicopter reportedly rushed to a street in Osney Mead near about 5pm. Read More 
Some residents thought the huge explosion was a vehicle running into the property in Gibbs Crescent. 
Another told local media they heard a "boom" and then firework sounds. 
Others reported that their nearby property shook from the explosion. 
It was said to be a three-story block of flats but the Oxford Mail reported the structure had been flattened. 
There has been no information relating to whether people were inside at the time of the blast. 
However, a firefighter reportedly rescued one person from a nearby building. 
Oxfordshire County Council Fire and Rescue sent six fire engines to the scene, it was reported. 
Resident Rosemary Preston told the newspaper she thought a gas explosion had occurred. 
“There was a terrific bang," she told the paper. 
"It was absolutely huge. Then there was so much smoke. 
“Apparently the wall of the second house on the road through to Gibbs Crescent has fallen down in a gas explosion. Read More Rollerblading boy causes gas explosion and gets knocked off his feet after throwing firework down manhole 
“There’s a line of five fire engines and goodness knows how many police cars. Ambulances have just gone by.” 
Oxford Bus Company tweeted: "Due to an incident at Osney Island, we are experiencing delays on our services. 
"The situation is slowly improving. Apologies." Like us on Facebook
